examples: The 1990s rap group Kris Kross had a radical style: They wore their clothes backwards!

images.description: A person skydiving from an airplane.
images.caption: Skydiving is an "extreme" or radical sport. That means it is a sport that is way out of the ordinary.

meanings.definition: To stretch out; to make longer.
examples: You can extend your goldfish’s life by keeping its water clean.

images.alt: Photo of a person reaching out and stretching to the side.
images.description: A person stretching her right leg out to her right side, and stretching her right arm  over her head and to her left side.
images.caption: This person is showing how to extend, or lengthen, the muscles on the right side of her body.

meanings.definition: A plan to solve a problem.
examples: The late Senator Ted Kennedy proposed an initiative that included extending the school day.
Reading and writing are crucial skills for doing well in school.
A single rehearsal is insufficient to get really good at playing a musical piece.

images.alt: Photo of a gas gauge on empty.
images.description: A gas gauge with the pointer at the edge indicating that the tank is empty.
images.caption: With the gauge on empty, there is not enough gas for this car to go anywhere!

examples: A global event such as a pandemic can impact the entire economy.

images.description: A world map showing most of the continents and oceans on Earth.
images.caption: Something that is global happens all across the world, in all different nations.

meanings.definition: To make a formal promise that something will happen.
examples: The new refrigerator came with a guarantee that it would work for at least one year.
Schools support students to work toward academic excellence.

images.alt: Photo of students raising hand in a classroom.
images.description: A teacher stands in the background, facing the viewer. Students face toward the teacher and raise their hands.
images.caption: When people are excited about learning, academic success goes up!

meanings.definition: A characteristic of how fine or good something is, including level of ability or performance.
examples: The quality of the student work was very impressive.

images.alt: Photo of person working, inspecting pieces of candy.
images.description: A person stands at a counter covered with small pieces of candy. The person wears a white face mask and hair net. He holds a piece of candy in his hand and is looking at it closely to make sure it is perfect.
images.caption: Careful inspection makes sure that each piece of candy is of the highest quality.

source.title: Nestlé Dubai manufacturing - Quality & safety checks
source.author: Nestlé

meanings.definition: To achieve or reach a goal.
examples: It took a year of hard work as class president for Vicky to attain the admiration and respect of her classmates.

images.alt: Photo of a person receiving an award.
images.description: A person receives an award during a ceremony.
images.caption: A person attains an award because of her hard work and achievements.
